1.title: Children with Cancer
1.text: During chemotherapy, young patients often require regular blood transfusions to support their treatment and recovery.

2.title: People Injured in Car Crashes or Accidents
2.text: Blood is needed urgently in emergencies — it can’t be bought, only donated in advance to save lives when seconds matter.

3.title: Patients with Chronic Illnesses
3.text: Conditions like anemia, hemophilia, or kidney failure often require long-term treatment with blood components.

4.title: Mothers in Complicated Births
4.text: In some cases, childbirth can involve severe bleeding — donated blood can save both the mother and the baby.
